history.content:
All I would say is an increase of 0.1 in your GPA isn't going to help you much and is probably not worth it..

----

From what I've seen with friends/family, you also need some years of work experience full-time to be eligible for a lot of the top MBA programs, so I don't think it's worth the money to stay an extra sem (and like the other poster said, 0.1 jump isn't really much).
All I would say is an increase of 0.1 in your GPA isn't going to help you much and is probably not worth it..
All I would say is an increase of 0.1 in you GPA isn't going to help you much and is probably not worth it..

children.subject: I am in a similar situation but for CS Master's programs instead. Is it more beneficial at this point to try to take easier classes to boost my GPA vs. take the semester off to do a Fall internship or take harder more "applicable" classes that I might get worse grades in?

history.content:
I’m an EECS major and I have completed my requirements already and my breadths and could graduate a semester early and the only real reason I would be staying my last semester would be to boost my gpa up as I have taken all the EECS courses I have wanted to take. My gpa currently is a 3.3 and with an extra semester of class (assuming I take an easy course load and get As) I would get a 3.4 ish. If I graduated early I would take the spring semester off and do an extra internship before doing fulltime. One of my goals is to obtain an MBA from a top business school and I know they care about gpa a lot. My question is, is it worth to take my last semester to boost my gpa up potentially by 0.1 for an MBA or graduate early, save money and do an internship but at the expense of my gpa not being high enough to get into a top MBA?

Thank you
history.subject: GPA Tradeoffs of graduating early
